fields.description:
This has now happened for me on 2 documents in a row.

I had a document that had H1 titles throughout the document. I changed them all to H2 tags, and added an H1 one at the top with the title of the document. Below the top H1 title, I added a table of contents starting at the 2nd level. Now all H1 tags are showing up the same at H2 tags (same horizontal line below and same font size). I checked the settings in wiki mark-up and everything looks proper there. I tried creating another H1 tag in another part of the article, but it looks like all the other H2 ones as well. I tried recreating the document by copying and pasting everything from the wiki mark-up, and the same thing happens.

I look forward to reading back on this issue.
fields.summary: H1 tags appear as H2 tags after converting all H1 to H2 tags below on Confluence 3.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26176].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Find an image with CMYK colour profile
# Attach the image to a page
# Edit the page
# Inserting the image itself is fine
# Go to Insert - Link > Attachments (or just Insert - Attachment) and you will see the error: "There was an error communicating with the server, please try again later.'

h3. Workaround
* Open the image in image editing software and save it, specifying RGB as the colour profile if required. Usually just saving the file will convert the colour profile, on most simple image editing software.
* If you require the CMYK profile on the images, the workaround is to embed them directly in the page, by Insert - Image. This will display the image, and it works fine. It is only thumbnails that have the problem.
* Host/upload the images to somewhere else (e.g. Dropbox, image hosting site, external site, etc.), then insert the image link through {{Insert - Link > Web Link}}. 

NB: Reproduced on the initial customer's space and on a clean instance of 4.2.11.
fields.summary: CMYK images cause an error in thumbnail view

fields.description:
This was raised in Support:
{quote}
One of our french users found a small translation issue in Confluence:
On a page with child pages, the number of child pages is shown as e.g. "4 enfants". Our french user says that this translation is wrong, correct would be "4 pages subordonnées".

Could you please fix this small translation issue?
{quote}


h4. Workaround
# Modify the following file:
confluence-install/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup/atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip/confluence-language-pack-fr_FR-<version>.jar/com/atlassian/confluence/core/*ConfluenceActionSupport_fr_FR.properties*
# Go to line 110 and modify it accordingly:
{code}
number.of.children={0} enfants
{code} 
# Save
# Restart Confluence

References:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Editing+Files+within+JAR+Archives
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Modify+Confluence+Interface+Text
- https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+A+New+Confluence+Translation
fields.summary: French translation of "Child Pages" ("enfants") is wrong

fields.description:
Is there a way to create a macro that will convert tabs to 4 spaces?

If you use the tabs in codeblock (using C++ language and default theme), it converts them to a single space.

It seems that when converted to html the tab becomes a single space – so if it is possible to change it so that tab automatically inserts spaces up to column position modulo tab_spacing (maybe 4 by default). 

Example of the problem - enter this into a code block:

tab test - should all be aligned - tab spacing is eight here
    one tabs
        eight spaces
        4 spaces then tab
end

Then view it in HTML or export to PDF
fields.summary: Tabs in codeblock being converted to spaces

fields.description:
When editing the settings on the Table of Contents macro, un-checking the "Printable" field makes the TOC invisible on the saved or previewed page. This affects our ability to render these pages as PDFs, as we need the Table of Contents for each technical manual page online but do not want it when we print our hard copies.

This is an issue in both IE9 and Chrome.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro - Disabling "Printable" field removes ToC from online views as well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26156].
  {panel}

Certain keyboard shortcuts used in Confluence is also used in certain browsers.

As an example, Ctrl+E is bound to Edit in confluence, but since Chrome (and IE... HOW did this Shortcut ever make it?) also has a action bound to this shortcut it does not work.

We could keep reporting in "X+Y doesn't work under Z Browser" but new shortcuts may emerge and we can do that all over again. Or it might be thrown back and forth among different browsers as we suddenly just hit a shortcut used by IE or FF etc.

So instead of that, let people customize the shortcuts instead, allowing to optionally use up to 2 modifier keys. So i could bind Edit to Ctrl+Shift+E or Ctrl+Q to circumvent the issue with Ctrl+E

That way you should effectively once and for all eliminate the need for any further reports on "colliding" shortcut keys...
fields.summary: User defined Keyboard Shortcuts.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26153].
  {panel}

When exporting to Word, images are in the file, but do not display (or appear to be blank images on Mac and red crosses on Windows). I have attached my test, and a screenshot of the original page I used to create the document. If you click in the right place, you can select the image, but no amount of moving, copying or resizing will convince it to display.

This is for regular inline images, not generated images (----CONF-25599----).
h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Add a new page.
 # Insert an image by going "Insert" -> "Image", then upload an image and attach it.
 # Save the page.
 # Go to "Tools" -> "Export to Word" and open the resulting *.doc file in Word for Mac 2011 and 2010.
 -- The image will not be visible, and just show a blank line in its place.
 -- Opening the same *.doc file in Word running on Windows will show the image.

h4. Resolution:

After investigation, it appears this issue has been fixed in Microsoft Office 2016. As our documentation currently lists Microsoft Office 2013 as the earliest supported version ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-connector-prerequisites-170493096.html)] , and there is no 2013 Office for mac, it is recommended that customers upgrade to Office 2016 to resolve this issue. Office 2016 has only been tested with Confluence 6.0.x. So while there is no fix contained in version 6.0.1, it is recommended that you upgrade to this version when you upgrade to Office 2016.
fields.summary: Export Page to Word - images do not display, in Office for Mac

fields.description:
On CAC I entered text in a Warning macro then changed my mind and wanted to use an Info macro. I copied the text out of the Warning macro and into the Info macro, and it nested the Warning macro including all text in the macro.

I tried to highlight the text conservatively by Shift-Left-ing, in case it was accidentally selecting the macro as well, but this had the same effect. I had to copy the text into a text editor then back into Confluence to get rid of the macro portion.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Warning macro and enter text
# Create Info macro above or below Warning macro
# Select and copy/cut text from the Warning macro into the Info macro (or vice versa)
# The entire macro will paste into the new macro, not just the text

NB: This does not occur on Chrome
fields.summary: Safari - Copying text from a Info/Warning macro copies the entire macro and text.
Confluence POP Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26147].
  {panel}

+*request for enhancement:*+

in WYSIWYG-editor: implement a new function in the text-definition drop-down menu or image settings for image and table subtitles *_with_* self-counting number to added subtitled images/tables to the page = subtitle with auto counting function

example:
\\

[inserted image]
_*image1:* this image shows blah blah blah_

[next inserted image]
_*image2:* this image shows blah blah blah_


\\
The more images with these subtitles you add the higher the image-number should count automatically - respectively the same for tables. The subtitle-prefix before counting number should also be customizable for different languages (e.g. english=image, german=Bild, etc. pp.) _*and*_ should being bound to which image or table it belongs (move or align image with subtitle).

I can also imagine to use the counter additionally as ancor because its unique at the page and finally it could even be used for page export functions (Word-file, PDF) to generate a table of contens for images or tables, eventually used as bookmarks in PDF-files (also according to enhancement CONF-26142).

thx very much
fields.summary: auto self-counting subtitles for images and tables

fields.description:
This bug only affects IE8.
It happens when we try to add an attachment on a page. For some reason, even if we change the "Link Text", after saving the page, the link will be shown with the Link Text+the name of the file.

Example:

I'm on a page, so I click on Insert > Attachment.
I pick a file called test.doc.
I change the Link Text to something else, like: "This is just a Test".

When we save the page the link will be shown as "This is just a Testtest.doc".
So every time we must edit the page again to delete the name of the file from the link.
fields.summary: Attachments being named wrong on IE8

fields.description:
Some words are rendered with wrong colour (marine blue instead of black) by native page export to PDF file. This effects just only a few complete words in attached PDF file: take a look at the word "Wo" in marked table headings (afterwards added arrows in PDF 'll gide you to the issue).

original webbrowser view (shows black coloured word 'Wo'): JIRA-Bug_PDF-export_original-view.png
result view as PDF (shows marine blue coloured word 'Wo'): JIRA-Bug_PDF-export_font-miscoloured.pdf

Why does it only effects the last three tables but not the first one? The first table was added via WYSIWYG-editor, but the last three ones via markup macro +w/o+ any colour arguments (= default colour) as absolutely like this:

{{|| Typ || Name || Wo || M-Typ | ... || ... ||}}
{{| | | | | | |}}

adding a table via markup is surely the key to this issue for the 'Wo'-word conspiracy :D

+*nearby (2nd bug):*+ the horizontal rows below the text headings are also not rendered in PDF file (!) (they were created via WYSIWYG-editor)
fields.summary: miscoloured words in PDF export text font rendering
ContentByLabel also show pages without the specific label

fields.description: The Navmap macro also includes deleted pages (with the right label). This is especially annoying since the only way to make it stop is to undelete the page, remove the label and delete the page again...
fields.summary: Navmap Macro should not include deleted pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26142].
  {panel}

*+request for enhancement:+*

for PDF-export function: it would be very useful to have a preview function as popup to get an overview about all pages _+before+_ the export process starts (like 'printer dialog' in windows OS apps) +*_and_*+ beeing able to switch page orientation for each page separately (horizontal <--> vertical) and also may something more.

*possible functions:*
- look&feel: as popup wizzard or like 'printer dialog' in windows OS applications
- switch page orientation between horizontal & vertical view separately by avoiding text orientation flip over (should remain vertical)
- adding pagebreaks
- PDF specific options/functions (security, password, restrictions, version compatibility)
- table of contens via heading definitions to bookmark entries in PDF-viewer
- PDF title (defineable title or filename)
- creator information (PDF metadata)
- watermarks
- view at document opening (standard, menu bar + bookmarks, fullscreen)


This could be very useful for tables which don't fit the papers width in size (e.g. letter, A4, ...) and also for operating systems without pdf authoring tools to manipulate PDF-files afterwards, respectively missing permissions to install them on their clients.

thx very much
fields.summary: PDF file export enhancement page orientation page-wise

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Edit or Add a page or a blogpost
# Click "Labels" and add a label
# The number of the Label button is set to 1 - correct
# Close the popup window
# Click on the button "Labels" again and no labels is visible
# Save the page and the labels are visible

This only happened when the page is in edit mode. If you try to add labels directly from the page, it works fine.
fields.summary: Labels are not visible

fields.description:
The excerpt of a short page (less than 255 characters) in search results includes the last change comment.

There are two issues with this behavior:
* (UI) There is no hint that this is the comment and not part of the actual document body
* (Security) The change comment is visible to anonymous users, which is undesirable in most cases.
fields.summary: Page excerpts in search results include latest change comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26138].
  {panel}

Unable to move a restricted page under another page within space. Reproducible  by the following steps:

# Create a user and a group, assign the user to the group
# Create a space
# Assign all permissions for the created space to the newly created user except *Space Admin*
# Create two pages within that space with the newly created user
# Set *Edit* and *View* restrictions on one of the pages for the newly created group
# Go to *Browse > Pages > View: Tree* and try moving the page with restictions set under the other page
# Operation will fail with the message _"You can not restrict pages in the destination space. Remove restrictions before moving page."_

According to [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Moving+a+Page] it should not require any other permissions.
fields.summary: Cannot move restricted page under another page within space

fields.description:
# Start adding a comment to a page.
 # Drag-and-drop some images in to your comment.
 # Delete the images from your comment (they will be attached to the page still).
 # Add a new Gallery Macro to your comment. 
_ the images you just removed from your comment will appear in the preview_
 # Save the comment.

You'll see something like this:
 !Screen shot 2012-07-25 at 5.55.16 PM.png!

Even though the page says this:
 !Screen shot 2012-07-25 at 5.55.29 PM.png!

And the "Insert Image" dialog says this:
 !Screen shot 2012-07-25 at 5.58.01 PM.png!
fields.summary: Gallery macro does not work in comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26134].
  {panel}

Problem: When editing a page with an embedded YouTube video, you don't really get a good feel of what the page will look like when you save it. 
http://cl.ly/image/1X1B0o1Z0B2R

Solution:
We should be able to modify the widget connector code to make use of the Confluence 4 rendererd placeholder API: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Providing+an+image+as+a+macro+placeholder+in+the+editor

YouTube provides a dead simple way to get the image of your video:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2068344/how-to-get-thumbnail-of-youtube-video-link-using-youtube-api

So when you are editing the page you should now get a rendered placeholder with an image of what it should look like!
fields.summary: Render the image of embedded youtube videos in the editor

fields.description:
There are two different but closely related scenarios.

1) Changing a page title
* Create Page B
* Create Page A in the same space and include a link to Page B.
** this link will be relative (it will have no spacekey)
* Edit Page B and change the title to 'Page C'

The link in Page A will now be absolute.

2) Moving a page to the same space
* Create Page B in Space B
* Create Page A in Space A and include a link to Page B
** this link will be absolute (it will have a spacekey)
* Move Page B to Space A

The link in Page A will wrongly be absolute to Space A (which is the space both pages are now in).
fields.summary: Relative internal links wrongly become absolute when the linked page is renamed or moved to the same space

{noformat}

and from the browser you may see this:
{code}Error 330 (net::ERR_CONTENT_DECODING_FAILED): Unknown error{code}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Upload some files to a page
# Click *Properties* on one of the attached files
# Change the file name of the file to include two or more colons. For example, {{my\my.ini}} or {{my::my.ini}}. Click save.
# Click *Download All* and the System Error is shown

Switching to database attachment storage does not solved the problem too.

h5. Workaround:
Discard {{\ / : * ? " < > |}} in the filename via Properties or download attachments individually instead of using the 'Download All'
fields.summary: System Error shown when clicking "download all" if a file name contains some characters

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a blogpost and add some contents. Note: No comment was added in the blogpost
# Result when you received 'Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours':
!1.JPG!

{code}Comment: blog post showing comment created by admin [9:00 PM]{code}
'blog post showing comment' is the title of the blogpost. It seems like a bug in the mail template.
fields.summary: Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours displayed comment for blogpost when there are no comment created in the blogpost
Provide font selection options for the WYSIWYG Editor

fields.description: For every change on a page that someone is watching there are two emails sent out by Confluence with the same content.
fields.summary: Watchers get Email Notification twice

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26127].
  {panel}

Hi Confluence Team,

many of our users often have to replace several attachments on a single page at the same time. They wish to have a function, to lock all attachments at the same time to edit.

Best regards,

Sebastian
fields.summary: Lock all attachments on a page to replace them

{code}

This issue is specific to the word document used and not happening to all word documents. The affected document seems to contain many headings. The same issue does not occur when there is no split or split level 1 headings is selected. Removing some contents and make it 37 pages instead of 70 pages allow the document to be imported successfully with split level 2 and split level 3 headings.
fields.summary: Import Word Document failed at split level 2 and split level 3 headings

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

After a user's SSO session expires, as long as they have the crowd_token cookie set in their browser, each page load of anonymous content will be slow until either the cookie is removed or they log in again. The amount of time it takes seems to vary, based on my own replication it usually takes about 5-10 seconds, but I've had reports of it taking 20-30 seconds to load pages. It is important to note that this does *not* affect the load speed of the dashboard, the login page, or the redirection to the login page when trying to access a restricted page.

No error message is logged in either Confluence or Crowd application logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up Crowd SSO on Confluence
# Log in as a crowd user
# Log in to crowd, expire that user's session
# Access any page that is anonymously accessible, other than the dashboard itself (i.e. inside of a space)

h3. Workaround

There are the following workarounds to get around the slow page loads:

* Log in again
* Manually delete the cookie using the browser settings
* Restart the browser so that the session cookie is automatically deleted
* Set the session expiry time to something very large so that this is hit less frequently
fields.summary: Confluence loads anonymous accessible pages slowly after SSO session times out but crowd.token_key cookie still exists
JIRA issues macro issue link to show link description instead of link name

fields.description:
I cannot remove a global space or a personal space. 

You can choose the option to remove the space, but the space is not actually deleted. I can go to the "Browse Pages" view and add a page to the space.

I reproduced the error in Confluence 4.3. A customer has reported this issue in a comment on the Confluence documentation, so it probably applies to other versions of Confluence too.

List of plugins known to cause this issue:
* Confluence Bubbles Plugin (Adaptavist)
* Descendant Notifications Plugin (Adaptavist)

h4. Workaround/Steps to resolve once a space has been semi-deleted
# Upgrade to Confluence 4.3.1 or above
# If you cannot upgrade to Confluence 4.3.1, disable these plugins if they are installed:
*- Confluence Bubbles Plugin (Adaptavist)
*- Descendant Notifications Plugin (Adaptavist)
# Go to <your-Confluence-url>/spaces/editspace.action?key=~username 
# Click on Remove Space to remove the space entirely
# Recreate the space
# Re-enable the plugins if you had to disable them in Step 2
fields.summary: Cannot delete a space

fields.description:
If I create a personal space, and then remove it again, there is no option in the menu to create the personal space again. The option is just "personal space" and leads me to the "Browse space" view.

The reason seems to be that the space is not actually deleted. I can go to the "Browse Pages" view and add a page to the space.

I reproduced the error in Confluence 4.3. A customer has reported this issue in a comment on the Confluence documentation, so it probably applies to other versions of Confluence too.
fields.summary: Cannot add personal space after removing it - probably because the space is not actually deleted

fields.description:
Editing a status macro in a page multiple times (or several status macro entries in one edit) increases memory usage of IE8 dramatically.

The increase is +10MB per edit if the sign: ✔ is present in the macro. The memory increase can also be experienced in other browsers, but not as much as in IE8.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a page inserting a status macro with ✔ character in it, for example: status 1 ✔
# Check memory usage of _iexplorer.exe_ in task manager
# Edit the status macro (no changes have to be made, just save it several times)
# Check the memory usage increase after each edit

*Workaround*
As a workaround you can save the page periodically, which then releases used up memory.
fields.summary: Editing status macro multiple times increases memory usage of IE8 dramatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26113].
  {panel}

Exported a page to Word, and this is at the top of the resulting HTML file (when opened in a text editor):

{code}Message-ID: <117338914.3.1343020657541.JavaMail.atlassian@Atlassians-MacBook-Air.local>
Subject: Exported From Confluence
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/related; 
	boundary="----=_Part_2_792693002.1343020657520"

------=_Part_2_792693002.1343020657520
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Location: file:///C:/exported.html
{code}

The file is not a valid Word document, in fact it rather seems to be a {{.eml}} or {{.mht}} file. It is basically coincidental that Microsoft Word can open the file. A major problem with even this is that *file:///C:/* prefix is added to each content element (images, etc), regardless to the operating system/browser that you use it for export. This path is not even valid on most Windows machines for such exports.

*Workaround*

A work around exists - export the page as a PDF, and convert the PDF to Microsoft Word Format:

# Export the page to PDF.  Once you do this, you can follow [this documentation|http://support.microsoft.com/kb/187700] to convert it to .doc.
# Use [this|http://www.adobe.com/products/acrobat/pdf-to-word-doc-converter.html] PDF to Word Doc Converter.
fields.summary: Export Page to Word should support Office, Open Office and Google Docs

fields.description:
When adding a web link, e.g. for:
https://plus.google.com/local/*/s/by:111201963613937477822

just copy and paste will break the markup and link is not clickable after saving.
It is clickable while in rich text mode just after insert, so this bug causes many "damn, doesn't work, have to re-edit the page"

Working: https://plus.google.com/local/%2A/s/by%3A111201963613937477822
or https://plus.google.com/local/%2A/s/by:111201963613937477822

so, just the * sign causes this problem and is not encoded correctly automatically to it's hex value 2A automatically by markup engine.

This is NOT a workaround, because I can't tell every stupid customer to know whats the correct, technical spelling for * signs in URL... perhaps there are related problems with other signes but the same cause too.. don't know, didn't find any related tickets for that.

If there are some, sorry and please feel free to close this while referring to them 

~Marcel
fields.summary: * sign (%2A) not working in web links and will break wiki markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26098].
  {panel}

The server.xml of the embedded tomcat server within our confluence standalone distribution contains a className attribute within its connector element that specifies org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector that does not exist in the tomcat libraries.

<Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector"

Tomcat does not throw any errors and starts fine

Changing it to 

<Connector className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.DodgyKebabConnector"  (which also does not exist)


Also does not cause tomcat to throw any errors and starts fine

The vanilla server.xml that comes with tomcat6 does not specify a className
Not specifying a className , also des not cause any issues, or throw an errors.
fields.summary: Connecter ClassName attribute in server.xml  not required

fields.description:
*When using the Shift+Enter line break function in Confluence, the two words are indexed as if there is no whitespace between them and they are treated as one word by the indexer.*

An example of this behaviour can be seen below:
 
Username: 123456
Password: abcdefg

The above content would result with the indexer seeing the strings *'123456'* and *'Password:'*, which have been separated by a Line Feed, (Shift+Enter), as one continuous string *'123456Password:'*.

Please see further illustration of this bug in the attached screenshots.


*Workaround:* Anyone impacted by this issue should add a space before using the Line Feed, (Shift+Enter), line break as this will ensure that the two strings are not seen as linked by the indexer
fields.summary: Line Feed, (Shift+Enter), line breaks cause the two surrounding words to be indexed as one word

On Chrome, combining two paragraphs using backspace or delete does not work when the second paragraph contains line breaks (
s)

fields.description: Text with the format strikethrough, which has been migrated from a version using wiki markup (previous to 4.0) does not change its format when you select it and select the option _strikethrough_. +Repro steps:+ # In a confluence 3.x create a page with some text with the format strikethrough (i.e.: -fred-) # Upgrade to confluence to 4.x # Edit the previous page, select the strikethrough text (-fred-) and click in the formatting option _strikethrough_. The format will not work. To make it more easy to reproduce I have attached a space xml backup with a test page showing the issue. The problem is the different format used for new added text and for migrated text. Migrated text is stored like {code} Crossed out text {code} while text created in 4.x is stored like {code} fred {code} +Workaround+ Use the button _Clear Formatting_ instead. This will clear any other existing format.
fields.summary: Strikethrough format uses incorrect XHTML when migrated from wiki markup

fields.description:

fields.description:
Since upgrading local Windows 7 64 bit workstations to IE9 we are no longer able to utilise the Drag and Drop features correctly.
Scenario 1: If I attempt to Drag a file from the local workstation file system onto a page, IE9 provides a prompt to either Open/Save or attempts to open the document (jpg, pdf) if a support addin is present. 

Scenario 2: If I attempt to drag a macro around while editing a page it will prompt me to install Google Gears. If I go ahead with the install of Google Gears this will allow me to drag macros around the page however File drag and drop will still not work.

I was under the impression that IE9 could handle drag and drop of local files and page content given its (so called) support for HTML5 and no longer required Google Gears? Am I correct?

If it should all work, is there anything in my IE settings that's preventing me from perporming these operations?
I've confirmed that

thank you

Tim

fields.description:
Confluence has not used the CONTENTLOCK table for many major versions. The recent changes around dropping this table (see CONF-25606) now trigger warnings on systems that never had it.

The warnings are harmless, but it would be better to never show them at all. That is, Confluence should check if the table exists and only remove it if it does.
fields.summary: Spurious warning when dropping CONTENTLOCK fails

concerning the activity stream on the Dashboard : If somone edits/creates a content part the indexer is working fine and the activty is shown in the activity stream, but if you now change the credentials of this page/content especially viewing restrictions the page must not be shown on the acitivty stream any more, but it still appears to all users - the index job should work for older/moved content too - not only for new entrys and activitys ... this is an important security concern.

Must have *JIRA* and *CONFLUENCE* running as trusted applications.

Steps to Reproduce:
* JIRA
#* Create two custom fields in JIRA, *Nominee* and *Nominee's manager* (both User picker type)
#* Create an issue and fulfil these custom fields with user names
#* Go to the issues search page, and execute any search which make the issues you've created appear
#* Copy the XML Link of this search (_Views > XML > Right-click "Copy Link Location"_)

* CONFLUENCE
#* Now, with the XML Link, *create a page*
#* Insert the ‘JIRA Issues’ Macro
#* Paste the XML Link into the *URL* field
#* In *JIRA Field Columns to Display* put {{nominee;nominee's manager;}}
#* Click on the Refresh button

Expected:
* The name of the tables *Nominee* and *Nominee's manager* should appear as *Nominee* and *Nominee's manager*.

Behavior:

Picture:
!JIRA_Issues_Macro.png!

Regards,
